thread.title: Lance Bass confirms NSYNC reunion and vinyl album | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Lance Bass confirms NSYNC reunion and vinyl album | Daily Mail Online

author: Dailymail.Com Reporter
title: Lance Bass confirms NSYNC reunion and vinyl album | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 262 shares It also seems the guys are once again being recognized for their talents, with Lance stating 'we're going to be getting our star on the [Hollywood] Walk of Fame this year at some point.' Then he dropped the big news, affirming that 'we'll all be there' for the awards ceremony. Taking a break: Nsync announced back in 2002 that they would go on hiatus Playing coy: 'We're doing something [special]. I don't know if I can announce it yet,' stated the Grammy nominated crooner, before spilling about some other big news about the band 'We just have to decide on a date. We're terrible at planning things. We're five guys, so for us to make a decision about anything is really hard, so we just need to do it. So hopefully maybe around Christmas time,' he said, adding 'It'll be fun to see everybody again.' While the reunion will no doubt be exciting for fans, the members of the famous boy band, which included Justin Timberlake, Chris Kirkpatrick, Joey Fatone and JC Chasez, have in fact mostly stayed in-touch with one another. Lance offered up a surprising assessment of their ongoing relationship: 'We talk daily, all five of us.' Honest: 'We just have to decide on a date. We're terrible at planning things,' admitted the Grammy-nominated singer He then went on to describe the nature of their interactions. 'I would have to shoot you if you saw the stuff we wrote to each other. we bag on each other all day long. We find pictures on Instagram of us from the '90s and so we're always giving it to each other.' While Lance has kept his hand in several entertainment endeavors, he's currently competing on Fox's My Kitchen Rules, which airs on Thursdays at 9pm. Like family: While the reunion will no doubt be exciting for fans, the members of the famous boy band, which included Justin Timberlake, Chris Kirkpatrick, Joey Fatone and JC Chasez, have in fact mostly stayed in-touch with one another
